docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama told House Democratic leaders Wednesday that they should include a tax on high-priced insurance policies in the final version of the health care legislation.

byline.contributor: Lynnley Browning in New Haven; Alison Leigh Cowan in Stamford, Conn.; and Robert Davey in Bridgeport, Conn., contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: For Democrats who see their political prospects this year as a tossup between catastrophic and merely horrible, there is hope on the horizon from a most unlikely source. No, not Rush Limbaugh, who recently praised his medical experience in the government-mandated, heavily unionized health care system of Hawaii. Mahalo to him.

headline.main: Health Care's Biggest Hypocrite — Or Hero

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney should have the courage of his convictions, even if it puts him in Democratic territory on health care.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney should have the courage of his convictions, even if it puts him in Democratic territory on health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 5:42 p.m. Congressional Democratic leaders, including the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, who represents San Francisco, are taking issue with Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger's criticism of the major health care legislation.

headline.main: Schwarzenegger: California Needs a 'Sweetheart Deal,' Too

docs.abstract: Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger says proposed health care legislation will saddle California with billions of dollars in additional costs. He wants the kind of deal Senator Ben Nelson got for Nebraska.
docs.snippet: Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger says proposed health care legislation will saddle California with billions of dollars in additional costs. He wants the kind of deal Senator Ben Nelson got for Nebraska.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

docs.lead_paragraph: Consumer-focused stories appear in various sections of The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them all up here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: How one community is recovering from the recession, a look at Google's new smartphone and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.
docs.snippet: How one community is recovering from the recession, a look at Google's new smartphone and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Could a health care overhaul lead to a raft of consumer lawsuits against insurers over medical claims denials?

headline.main: Will Exchanges Spur Lawsuits? Maybe Not

docs.abstract: Individuals insured through the proposed national exchanges would have greater rights to sue over denied claims than they do now under employer-based plans. But patients still aren't likely to rush to court, some experts say.
docs.snippet: Individuals insured through the proposed national exchanges would have greater rights to sue over denied claims than they do now under employer-based plans. But patients still aren't likely to rush to court, some experts say.

docs.lead_paragraph: 2010 Election Dispatches The departures of two Democratic Senators, Christopher Dodd of Connecticut and Byron Dorgan of North Dakota, puts the party's precarious hold on the Senate more plainly than ever at risk.
docs.abstract: The Senate faces a shake-up as two Democrats won't run again.
docs.snippet: The Senate faces a shake-up as two Democrats won't run again.
